gurmukhi: jb AweI hY kwqk kI ruq sIql kwnH qbY Aiq hI rsIAw ] sMg gopn Kyl ibcwr krXo ju huqo Bgvwn mhw jsIAw ]
transliteration: Jab Aaihai Kaatak Kirout Seetal Kaahn Tahai At(i) Raseeaa|| San Gopan Khel Bichaar Daryo Ju Houto Bhagvaan Mahaa Jaseeaa||
translation: When the winter of the month of Kartik arrived, then the aesthete Krishna thought about his amorous sport with the gopis;

gurmukhi: Apiv`qRn logn ky ijh ky pg lwgq pwp sBY nsIAw ] iqh ko suin qRIXn ky sMg Kyl invwrhu kwnH iehY bsIAw ]441]
transliteration: Apavittran Logad Le Jih Ke Pag Laagad Paap Sobhai Naseeaa|| Tih Ko Soun(i) Treeyan Ke San Khel Nidaroh Kaahn Ihai Baseeaa||441||
translation: The sins of the impious people are destroyed by the touch of the feet of Krishna; hearing about the thought of Krishna regarding his amorous sport with the women, all the gopis gathered around him from all the four sides.441.

gurmukhi: Awnn jwih inswpiq so diRg koml hY kmlw dl kYsy ] hY Bruty Dn sy brnIsr dUr krY qn ky duK rYsy ]
transliteration: Oonan Jaah(i) Nisaapat(i) So Dirg Komal Hai Kamlaa Dal Kaise|| Hai Bharoute Dhan Se Barneesar Door Darai Tan Ke Doukh Raise||
translation: Their faces are like moon, their delicate eyes like lotus, their eyebrows like bows and their eyelashes like arrows; seeing such beautiful women, all the sufferings of the body are effeced;

gurmukhi: kwm kI swn ky swQ Gsy duK swDn ky ktby khu qYsy ] kaul ky pqR ikDo sis swQ lgy kib suMdr sXwm ArYsy ]442]
transliteration: Kaan Kisaan Ke Saath Ghase Doukh Saadhan Ke Katbe Kauh Taise|| Kaull Ke Patra Kidho Sas(i) Saath Lage Kabi Soundar Syaamdaraise||442||
translation: The bodies of these wanton ladies are like the weapons rubbed and sharpened on the whet stone of lust for the removal of the sufferings of saints; they all appear like the lotus-leaves connected with the moon.442.

gurmukhi: bMDk hY ttIAw brunIDr korn kI duq swiek swNDy ] TwFy hY kwnH ikDo bl mY qn pY isr pY AMbuvw rMg bwNDy ]
transliteration: Bandhak Hai Tateeaa Barouneedhar Koran Kidout Saaik Saandhe|| Thaadhe Hai Kaahn Kidho Bal Mai Tan Pai Sir Pai Anbuvaa Ran Baandhe||
translation: With the girdle tied around his waist and having the eyelashes straightened like arrows, with a yellow cloth tied over the head, Krishna is standing in the forest;

gurmukhi: cwl clY hrUey hrUey mno sIK deI ieh b`Dk pwNpy ] Aau sB hI Tt b`D ksy mn mohn jwl pIqMbr kwNDy ]443]
transliteration: Dhaal Chalai Darooaa Darooe Mano Seekh Daieh Baddhak Paandhe|| Au Sabh Hithat Badhh Kase Man Mohan Jaal Peetanbar Kaandhe||443||
translation: He is moving slowly as if he had been instructed by someone to walk slowly; having the yellow garment on his shoulder and having tied the waist tightly, he looks extremely impressive.443.

gurmukhi: so auT TwiF ikDy bn mY jug qIsr mY piq joaU sIXw ] jmnw mih Kyl ky kwrn kO Gs cMdn Bwl mY tIko dIXw ]
transliteration: So Outh Thaadh(i) Kidhe Ban Mai Joug Teesar Mai Pat(i) Jooo Seeyaa|| Jamnaa Maih Khel Ke Kaaran Kau Ghas Channdan Dhaal Mai Teekyo Deeyaa||
translation: He, who was Ram, the husband of Sita, in Treta age, he is now standing there in the forest and in order to exhibit his play in Yamuna, he has applied the frontal mark of sandal on his forehead;

gurmukhi: iBlrw fr nYn ky sYnn ko sB gopn ko mn cor lIXw ] kib sXwm khY Bgvwn ikDo rs kwrn ko Tg bys kIXw ]444]
transliteration: Bhilraa Dar Nain Ke Sainan Ko Sabh Gopan Ko Man Chor Leeyaa|| Kbi Syaam Kahai Bhagvaan Kidho Ras Kaaram Ko Thag Bes Keeya||444||
translation: Seeing the signs of his eyes, the Bhils are getting terrified, the hearts of all the gopis are allured by Krishna; the poet Shyam says that in order to give pleasure to all, the Lord (Krishna) has assumed the garb of a Thug.444.

gurmukhi: diRg jwih miRgIpiq kI sm hY muK jwih inswpiq sI Cib pweI ] jwih kurMgn ky irp sI kt kMcn sI qn nY Cib CweI ]
transliteration: Drig Jaah(i) Mrigeepat(i) Kisam Hai Moukh Jaah(i) Nisaapat(i) Sichhah(i) Paaee|| Jaah(i) Kuranad Ke Rip Sikat Kanchanndsitan Nai Chhah(i) Chhaade||
translation: The beauty of the limbs of those wanton ladies, whose eyes are like the doe, the beauty of the face like the moon, the waist like the lion;

gurmukhi: pwt bny kdlI dl dÍY jMGÍw pr qIrn sI duq gweI ] AMg pRqMg su suMdr sXwm kCU aupmw khIAY nhI jweI ]445]
transliteration: Paat Bade Kadalidal Dvai Janhvaa Par Tderan Sidout Gadee|| An Pratan Su Soundar Syaam Kachhodh Oupmaa Kaheeai Nahijaaee||445||
translation: Their legs are like the trunk of the Kadli (Banana) tree and their beauty pierces like an arrow the elegance of the body like the gold, can’t be described.445.
